alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 21 at 3:34AM PDT until March 22 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Snowfall of 6 to 12 inches is expected, mostly above 5000 feet, locally greater on the highest peaks. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 10 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 120 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow level will be rise to near 7500 feet this morning, then fall to around 5500 feet for late this afternoon and 4000 feet for late tonight. The snow level will then fluctuate around 4500 feet for Wednesday afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
